text: I wish that it was more widely known
that there's a lot of science behind
responsible AI we do a great deal of
work internally at AWS and this is
mainly what I'm involved with there
around carefully assessing our models
not just for their overall performance
but for their performance by demographic
subgroup so we're looking to mitigate or
eradicate demographic bias or
variability and performance in our
models we're interested in preserving
their privacy we want them to be robust
we want them to be as explainable as
possible in the last 10 years we've gone
from this initial period where there's
just this Fascination Around The Growing
Power of AI and ml then people started
realizing oh okay this stuff is really
powerful and what it's intended to do
but it also has these potentially
harmful side effects now there's quite a
bit of science around at least certain
subtopics and responsible AI like
fairness a new phenomenon that many
viewers might be aware of with an AI and
machine learning is the very recent rise
of generative models in Ai and these are
very very powerful impressive
Technologies and I think that they open
up a huge new world of use cases and I
think a whole new set of concerns as
well this includes concerns over things
like toxicity and the output of these
models or the ways that they might be
misused and so I think that this is
going to be an important topic in coming
years
[Music]
